message.content: {"id": "21706", "title": "Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage", "description": "Bug 21706 - BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage", "OB": "The BidiUtil class in the org.eclipse.swt.internal package has a line that uses the Class.forName() method to create a new instance of the Callback class. The BidiUtil.class is a syntactic sugar for Class.forName(\"org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil\").", "EB": "The usage of Class.forName() in the BidiUtil class in win32 should be removed to avoid a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT. The reflection in this line can be replaced with a direct class instantiation.", "SR": "Modify the BidiUtil class in win32 to replace the usage of Class.forName() with a direct class instantiation to prevent a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '21706', 'title': 'Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage', 'description': 'Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage ', 'OB': 'Well, kind of.And so what if it does?OK, 2047 has a line in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil of:static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);The BidiUtil.class is syntactic sugar for Class.forName("org...BidiUtil").Theproblem with this is that method throws a NoClassDefFoundError, which is notdefined in the CLDC class libraries, which causes us a little problem in theCLDC version of SWT.You\'d only see this problem if you verified or usedjxeLink or something; the compiler gens the call itself, and just assumesNoClassDefFoundError is around, so you won\'t ever get a compiler error from theeclipse compiler (nor Sun\'s compiler).So, I\'d like this changed.Here\'s the simplest way to change to remove thereflection. ', 'EB': '', 'SR': ''}
